simple_sql.database package¶

simple_sql.database¶

class simple_sql.database.Database(host: str, user: str, password: str, metadata: simple_sql.metadata.MetaData)¶

This is the main class of the module. Using the methods in this class you can create, drop, select, update, insert into and delete tables. First you must select the database, for now this works only on a database level (not serer level like grant options). There is also the possibility of executing custom queries but you should use that function correctly. When initialized the class will connect to the server using the provided credentials, create the connection and the cursor.

Note

The user must create a simple_sql.metadata.MetaData object to pass to the instance but the class will take care of updating it.

Parameters

  • host (str) – The host of the server to connect to.

  • user (str) – The name of the user to use for login.

  • password (str) – The string of the password.

  • metadata (MetaData) – The metadata instance.

__credentials¶

The dictionary for the credentials.

Type

Dict[str, str]

__metadata¶

The metadata instance.

Type

MetaData

__connection¶

The connection to the MySQL server.

Type

MySQLConnection

__cursor¶

The cursor to execute the statements.

Type

CursorBase

create_table(table: simple_sql.model.table.Table)¶

Creates a table and adds it to the metadata instance. Commits the changes to the connection.

Parameters

table (Table) – The Table to add to the database.

delete(table: str) → simple_sql.wrappers.delete_wrapper.DeleteWrapper¶

Initialize a delete statement with the name of the table to delete from.

Parameters

table (str) – The name of the table to delete from.

drop_table(table: str) → simple_sql.wrappers.drop_table_wrapper.DropTableWrapper¶

Initialize a drop table statement with the name of the table to drop. This method also removes the table from the metadata instance.

Parameters

table (str) – The name of the table to drop.

Returns

A DropTableWrapper instance with the current metadata instance and the provided table name.

Return type

DropTableWrapper

execute(query: SelectWrapper | AnyStr | object) → List[Dict]¶

Execute a query. To execute the queries you create using the appropriate methods you should provide the return value of the method. If the query is a select statement you can obtain the output of the statement. You can also use this method to execute a custom query providing a string in MySQL compliant syntax.

Warning

Be careful while executing custom queries because in that case the execution is unchecked.

Parameters

query (str or object) – A string or a wrapper object.

Returns

The result of the fetchall of the execution. If the query is a select statement the result is parsed as a list of dictionaries with table.column key format and the respective value. If the query is not a select statement the result is a list of tuples.

Return type

List[Dict] or List[Tuple]

get_databases(print_them: bool = True) → List[str]¶

Use this method to see which databases are available. To disable the log print of the list pass False as print_them parameter.

Parameters

print_them (bool, default True) – True if the function should print the list.

Returns

A list of the names of the databases.

Return type

List[str]

insert_into(table: AnyStr, columns: Optional[List] = None) → simple_sql.wrappers.insert_into_wrapper.InsertIntoWrapper¶

Initialize a insert into statement with the name of the table to insert into and eventually the set of column to insert into.

Parameters

  • table (str) – The name of the table to insert into.

  • columns (List[str]) – The list of column names to insert into.

Returns

An InsertIntoWrapper instance with the current metadata instance and the provided table name and eventually columns list.

Return type

InsertIntoWrapper

select(select_clause: List[str]) → simple_sql.wrappers.select_wrapper.SelectWrapper¶

Initialize a select statement with the select clause. The select clause is a list of strings that will be used to create the select AND from clause. It must be formatted as follows:

  • Use the format table.column if you want to add a single column to the selection, the table will be added to the from clause.

  • Use the format table if you want to add all the columns of the table to the selection, the table will be added to the from clause.

You can make a list that mixes these two formats.

Parameters

select_clause (List[str]) – The list of select clause columns.

Returns

A SelectWrapper instance with the current metadata instance and the provided select clause.

Return type

SelectWrapper

select_database(database: str)¶

Use this method to select the working database.

Parameters

database (str) – The name of the database to select. Use get_databases to obtain all the available databases.

Raises

NoSuchDatabase – If the requested database does not exists.

update(table: str) → simple_sql.wrappers.update_wrapper.UpdateWrapper¶

Initialize a update statement with the name of the table to update.

Parameters

table (str) – The name of the table to update.

Returns

An UpdateWrapper instance with the current metadata instance and the provided table name.

Return type

UpdateWrapper
